author: ryanleeschneider
content:
Would clients just implement their own bespoke index for `eth_getLogs`?  As Marius said the current bloom probably has way too many false positives so in many ways it's probably preferable to leave indexing of the logs up to the client teams.

Also is there any way we can figure out how to make this somehow "retroactive"?  Like what if we computed roots w/o the blooms in the receipts and a block header and stored/verified that in some aux struct that was gossiped and used as an alternate means to verify the blocks?  Or is that overkill if history-expiry is already in the pipe?

author: _shemnon
content: Clients already do have custom indexes.

author: _shemnon
content: For retroactive we can just not gossip the bloom and not store the bloom, and instead re-hydrate it when we need to calculate the hash.

author: _shemnon
content: If you have the receipt logs and all the receipts for the block you can rebuild the bloom fairly fast.

author: _shemnon
content: And if you are not validating the hash it doesn't matter, which is something you only typically do the first time a block hits your storage.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I think the biggest gain would be to remove the tx receipt bloom from the wire messages and let the recipient recompute it
